endpoints.description: Return basic information about the API

endpoints.name: /agents
endpoints.description: Return information about all available agents or a list of them

query.name: agents_list
query.description: List of agent IDs (separated by comma), all agents selected by default if not specified

query.name: ip
query.description: Filter by the IP used by the agent to communicate with the manager. If it's not available, it will have the same value as registerIP

query.name: limit
query.description: Maximum number of elements to return. Although up to 100.000 can be specified, it is recommended not to exceed 500 elements. Responses may be slower the more this number is exceeded.

query.name: manager
query.description: Filter by manager hostname where agents are connected to

query.name: offset
query.description: First element to return in the collection

query.name: older_than
query.description: Filter out agents whose time lapse from last keep alive signal is longer than specified. Time in seconds, ‘[n_days]d’, ‘[n_hours]h’, ‘[n_minutes]m’ or ‘[n_seconds]s’. For never_connected agents, uses the register date. For example, `7d`, `10s` and `10` are valid values. If no time unit is specified, seconds are used

query.name: q
query.description: Query to filter results by. For example q="status=active"

query.name: registerIP
query.description: Filter by the IP used when registering the agent

query.name: search
query.description: Look for elements containing the specified string. To obtain a complementary search, use '-' at the beginning

query.name: select
query.description: Select which fields to return (separated by comma). Use '.' for nested fields. For example, '{field1: field2}' may be selected with 'field1.field2'

query.name: sort
query.description: Sort the collection by a field or fields (separated by comma). Use +/- at the beggining to list in ascending or descending order. Use '.' for nested fields. For example, '{field1: field2}' may be selected with 'field1.field2'

query.name: status
query.description: Filter by agent status (use commas to enter multiple statuses)

query.name: version
query.description: Filter by agents version using one of the following formats: 'X.Y.Z', 'vX.Y.Z', 'wazuh X.Y.Z' or 'wazuh vX.Y.Z'. For example: '4.4.0'

endpoints.name: /agents/:agent_id/config/:component/:configuration
endpoints.description: Return the active configuration the agent is currently using. This can be different from the configuration present in the configuration file, if it has been modified and the agent has not been restarted yet

args.name: :agent_id
args.description: Agent ID. All possible values from 000 onwards

args.name: :configuration
args.description:
Selected agent's configuration to read. The configuration to read depends on the selected component. The following table shows all available combinations of component and configuration values:

Component Configuration Tag
agent client <client>
agent buffer <client_buffer>
agent labels <labels>
agent internal <agent>, <monitord>, <remoted>
agent anti_tampering <anti_tampering>
analysis global <global>
analysis active_response <active-response>
analysis alerts <alerts>
analysis command <command>
analysis internal <analysisd>
auth auth <auth>
com active-response <active-response>
com logging <logging>
com internal <execd>
com cluster <cluster>
logcollector localfile <localfile>
logcollector socket <socket>
logcollector internal <logcollector>
mail global <global><email...>
monitor global <global>
monitor internal <monitord>
monitor reports <reports>
request global <global>
request remote <remote>
request internal <remoted>
syscheck syscheck <syscheck>
syscheck rootcheck <rootcheck>
syscheck internal <syscheck>, <rootcheck>
wazuh-db internal <wazuh_db>
wazuh-db wdb <wdb>
wmodules wmodules <wodle>

endpoints.name: /agents/:agent_id/daemons/stats
endpoints.description: Return Server statistical information from specified daemons in a specified agent
endpoints.summary: Get Server daemon stats from an agent

args.name: :agent_id
args.description: Agent ID. All possible values from 000 onwards

query.name: daemons_list
query.description: List of daemon names (separated by comma), all daemons selected by default if not specified

endpoints.name: /agents/:agent_id/group/is_sync
endpoints.description: Return whether the agent configuration has been synchronized with the agent or not. This can be useful to check after updating a group configuration

args.name: :agent_id
args.description: Agent ID. All possible values from 000 onwards

endpoints.name: /agents/:agent_id/key
endpoints.description: Return the key of an agent

args.name: :agent_id
args.description: Agent ID. All possible values from 000 onwards

endpoints.name: /agents/:agent_id/stats/:component
endpoints.description: Return Server's {component} statistical information from agent {agent_id}

args.name: :agent_id
args.description: Agent ID. All possible values from 000 onwards

endpoints.name: /agents/no_group
endpoints.description: Return a list with all the available agents without an assigned group

query.description: Maximum number of elements to return. Although up to 100.000 can be specified, it is recommended not to exceed 500 elements. Responses may be slower the more this number is exceeded.

query.name: offset
query.description: First element to return in the collection

query.name: q
query.description: Query to filter results by. For example q="status=active"

query.name: search
query.description: Look for elements containing the specified string. To obtain a complementary search, use '-' at the beginning

query.name: select
query.description: Select which fields to return (separated by comma). Use '.' for nested fields. For example, '{field1: field2}' may be selected with 'field1.field2'

query.name: sort
query.description: Sort the collection by a field or fields (separated by comma). Use +/- at the beggining to list in ascending or descending order. Use '.' for nested fields. For example, '{field1: field2}' may be selected with 'field1.field2'

endpoints.description: Return a summary of the available agents OS, status and groups

query.name: agents_list

endpoints.name: /agents/summary/os

query.name: daemons_list
query.description: List of daemon names (separated by comma), all daemons selected by default if not specified

endpoints.name: /cluster/:node_id/info
endpoints.description: Return basic information about a specified node such as version, compilation date, installation path

endpoints.name: /cluster/:node_id/logs
endpoints.description: Return the last 2000 wazuh log entries in the specified node

query.name: limit
query.description: Maximum number of lines to return.

query.name: offset
query.description: First element to return in the collection

query.name: q

query.name: search
query.description: Look for elements containing the specified string. To obtain a complementary search, use '-' at the beginning

query.name: select

query.name: sort

endpoints.name: /cluster/:node_id/stats

query.name: date
query.description: Date to obtain statistical information from. Format YYYY-MM-DD

endpoints.name: /cluster/:node_id/stats/analysisd
endpoints.description: Return Server analysisd statistical information in node {node_id}

endpoints.name: /cluster/:node_id/stats/hourly
endpoints.description: Return Server statistical information in node {node_id} per hour. Each number in the averages field represents the average of alerts per hour

endpoints.name: /cluster/:node_id/stats/remoted
endpoints.description: Return Server remoted statistical information in node {node_id}

endpoints.name: /cluster/:node_id/stats/weekly
endpoints.description: Return Server statistical information in node {node_id} per week. Each number in the averages field represents the average of alerts per hour for that specific day

endpoints.name: /cluster/:node_id/status
endpoints.description: Return the status of all Server daemons in node node_id

query.name: nodes_list

endpoints.name: /active-response

endpoints.name: /agents/upgrade
endpoints.description: Upgrade agents using a WPK file from online repository. When upgrading more than 3000 agents at the same time, it's highly recommended to use the parameter `wait_for_complete` set to `true` to avoid a possible API timeout

query.name: agents_list
query.description: List of agent IDs (separated by comma), use the keyword `all` to select all agents

query.name: ip
query.description: Filter by the IP used by the agent to communicate with the manager. If it's not available, it will have the same value as registerIP

query.name: manager
query.description: Filter by manager hostname where agents are connected to

query.name: package_type
query.description: Select package type to use. By default, the manager infers this.

query.name: q
query.description: Query to filter results by. For example q="status=active"

query.name: registerIP
query.description: Filter by the IP used when registering the agent

query.name: use_http
query.description: Use http protocol. If it's false use https. By default the value is set to false

query.name: version
query.description: Filter by agents version using one of the following formats: 'X.Y.Z', 'vX.Y.Z', 'wazuh X.Y.Z' or 'wazuh vX.Y.Z'. For example: '4.4.0'

endpoints.name: /agents/upgrade_custom
endpoints.description: Upgrade the agents using a local WPK file. When upgrading more than 3000 agents at the same time, it's highly recommended to use the parameter `wait_for_complete` set to `true` to avoid a possible API timeout

query.name: agents_list
query.description: List of agent IDs (separated by comma), use the keyword `all` to select all agents

query.name: file_path
query.description: Full path to the WPK file. The file must be on a folder on the Server's installation directory (by default, /var/ossec)

query.name: installer
query.description: Installation script. Default is upgrade.sh or upgrade.bat for windows agents

query.name: ip
query.description: Filter by the IP used by the agent to communicate with the manager. If it's not available, it will have the same value as registerIP

query.name: manager
query.description: Filter by manager hostname where agents are connected to

query.name: q
query.description: Query to filter results by. For example q="status=active"

query.name: registerIP
query.description: Filter by the IP used when registering the agent

query.name: version
query.description: Filter by agents version using one of the following formats: 'X.Y.Z', 'vX.Y.Z', 'wazuh X.Y.Z' or 'wazuh vX.Y.Z'. For example: '4.4.0'

endpoints.name: /cluster/:node_id/configuration
endpoints.description: Replace wazuh configuration for the given node with the data contained in the API request

endpoints.name: /cluster/restart
endpoints.description: Restart all nodes in the cluster or a list of them

query.name: nodes_list
query.description: List of node IDs (separated by comma), all nodes selected by default if not specified

endpoints.name: /groups/:group_id/configuration
endpoints.description: Update an specified group's configuration. This API call expects a full valid XML file with the shared configuration tags/syntax

endpoints.name: /rootcheck
endpoints.description: Run rootcheck scan in all agents or a list of them

query.name: agents_list
query.description: List of agent IDs (separated by comma), all agents selected by default if not specified

endpoints.name: /security/config
endpoints.description: Update the security configuration with the data contained in the API request

auth_token_exp_timeout.description: Time in seconds until the token expires

endpoints.name: /security/policies/:policy_id
endpoints.description: Modify a policy, at least one property must be indicated

resources.description: Resources to apply the actions on

endpoints.name: /security/roles/:role_id
endpoints.description: Modify a role, cannot modify associated policies in this endpoint, at least one property must be indicated

endpoints.name: /security/rules/:rule_id
endpoints.description: Modify a security rule by specifying its ID

endpoints.name: /security/user/revoke
endpoints.description: This method should be called to revoke all active JWT tokens

endpoints.name: /security/users/:user_id
endpoints.description: Modify a user's password by specifying their ID

endpoints.name: /security/users/:user_id/run_as
endpoints.description: Modify a user's allow_run_as flag by specifying their ID

endpoints.name: /syscheck
endpoints.description: Run FIM scan in all agents

query.name: agents_list
query.description: List of agent IDs (separated by comma), all agents selected by default if not specified

endpoints.name: /agents
endpoints.description: Add a new agent

ip.description: If this is not included, the API will get the IP automatically. Allowed values: IP, IP/NET, ANY

endpoints.name: /agents/insert
endpoints.description: Add an agent specifying its name, ID and IP. If an agent with the same name, the same ID or the same IP already exists, replace it using the `force` parameter

key.description: Key to use when communicating with the manager. The agent must have the same key on its `client.keys` file

ip.description: If this is not included, the API will get the IP automatically. Allowed values: IP, IP/NET, ANY

force.description: Remove the old agent with the same name, ID or IP if the configuration is matched

value.description: Time the agent must has been disconnected to force the insertion. Time in seconds, ‘[n_days]d’, ‘[n_hours]h’, ‘[n_minutes]m’ or ‘[n_seconds]s’. For example, `7d`, `10s` and `10` are valid values. If no time unit is specified, seconds are used

after_registration_time.description: Time the agent must has been registered to force the insertion. Time in seconds, ‘[n_days]d’, ‘[n_hours]h’, ‘[n_minutes]m’ or ‘[n_seconds]s’. For example, `7d`, `10s` and `10` are valid values. If no time unit is specified, seconds are used

endpoints.name: /agents/insert/quick
endpoints.description: Add a new agent with name `agent_name`. This agent will use `any` as IP

query.name: agent_name
query.description: Agent name. The special characters allowed are: '-','_','.'

endpoints.name: /events
endpoints.description:
Send security events to analysisd.

The endpoint is limited to receiving a max of 30 requests per minute and a max bulk size of 100 events per request.

endpoints.name: /groups
endpoints.description: Create a new group

group_id.description: Group name. It can contain any of the characters between a-z, A-Z, 0-9, '_', '-' and '.'. Names '.' and '..' are restricted.

endpoints.name: /security/policies
endpoints.description: Add a new policy, all fields need to be specified

resources.description: Resources to apply the actions on

endpoints.name: /security/roles
endpoints.description: Add a new role, all fields need to be specified

endpoints.name: /security/roles/:role_id/policies
endpoints.description: Create a specified relation role-policy, one role may have multiples policies

endpoints.name: /security/roles/:role_id/rules
endpoints.description: Create a specific role-rule relation. One role may have multiple security rules

query.name: rule_ids
query.description: List of rule IDs (separated by comma)

endpoints.name: /security/rules
endpoints.description: Add a new security rule

endpoints.name: /security/user/authenticate
endpoints.description: This method should be called to get an API token. This token will expire after auth_token_exp_timeout seconds (default: 900). This value can be changed using PUT /security/config

endpoints.name: /security/user/authenticate/run_as
endpoints.description: This method should be called to get an API token using an authorization context body. This token will expire after auth_token_exp_timeout seconds (default: 900). This value can be changed using PUT /security/config

endpoints.name: /security/users
endpoints.description: Add a new API user to the system

endpoints.name: /security/users/:user_id/roles
endpoints.description: Create a specified relation role-policy, one user may have multiples roles

query.name: role_ids
query.description: List of role IDs (separated by comma)

endpoints.name: /agents
endpoints.description: Delete all agents or a list of them based on optional criteria

query.name: agents_list
query.description: List of agent IDs (separated by comma), use the keyword `all` to select all agents

query.name: ip
query.description: Filter by the IP used by the agent to communicate with the manager. If it's not available, it will have the same value as registerIP

query.name: manager
query.description: Filter by manager hostname where agents are connected to

query.name: older_than
query.description: Consider only agents whose last keep alive is older than the specified time frame. For never_connected agents, register date is considered instead of last keep alive. For example, `7d`, `10s` and `10` are valid values. When no time unit is specified, seconds are assumed. Use 0s to select all agents

query.name: purge
query.description:
Permanently delete an agent from the key store. The wazuh-authd `purge` configuration option has
precedence over this parameter, when enabled, agents will be permanently deleted regardless of this value.

query.name: q
query.description: Query to filter results by. For example q="status=active"

query.name: registerIP
query.description: Filter by the IP used when registering the agent

query.name: status
query.description: Filter by agent status (use commas to enter multiple statuses)

query.name: version
query.description: Filter by agents version using one of the following formats: 'X.Y.Z', 'vX.Y.Z', 'wazuh X.Y.Z' or 'wazuh vX.Y.Z'. For example: '4.4.0'

endpoints.name: /agents/:agent_id/group
endpoints.description: Remove the agent from all groups or a list of them. The agent will automatically revert to the default group if it is removed from all its assigned groups

args.name: :agent_id
args.description: Agent ID. All possible values from 000 onwards

query.name: groups_list
query.description: List of group IDs (separated by comma), all groups selected by default if not specified

endpoints.name: /agents/:agent_id/group/:group_id
endpoints.description: Remove an agent from a specified group. If the agent belongs to several groups, only the specified group will be deleted.

args.name: :agent_id
args.description: Agent ID. All possible values from 000 onwards

endpoints.name: /agents/group
endpoints.description: Remove all agents assignment or a list of them from the specified group

query.name: agents_list
query.description: List of agent IDs (separated by comma), use the keyword `all` to select all agents

endpoints.name: /groups
endpoints.description: Delete all groups or a list of them

query.name: groups_list
query.description: List of group IDs (separated by comma), use the keyword 'all' to select all groups

endpoints.name: /security/config
endpoints.description: Replaces the security configuration with the original one

endpoints.name: /security/policies
endpoints.description: Delete a list of policies or all policies in the system, roles linked to policies are not going to be removed

query.name: policy_ids
query.description: List of policy IDs (separated by comma), use the keyword 'all' to select all policies

endpoints.name: /security/roles
endpoints.description: Policies linked to roles are not going to be removed

query.name: role_ids
query.description: List of role IDs (separated by comma), use the keyword 'all' to select all roles

endpoints.name: /security/roles/:role_id/policies
endpoints.description: Delete a specified relation role-policy

query.name: policy_ids
query.description: List of policy IDs (separated by comma), use the keyword 'all' to select all policies

endpoints.name: /security/roles/:role_id/rules
endpoints.description: Delete a specific role-rule relation

query.name: rule_ids
query.description: List of rule IDs (separated by comma), use the keyword 'all' to select all rules

endpoints.name: /security/rules
endpoints.description: Delete a list of security rules or all security rules in the system, roles linked to rules are not going to be deleted

query.name: rule_ids
query.description: List of rule IDs (separated by comma), use the keyword 'all' to select all rules

endpoints.name: /security/user/authenticate
endpoints.description: This method should be called to invalidate all the current user's tokens

endpoints.name: /security/users
endpoints.description: Delete a list of users by specifying their IDs

query.name: user_ids
query.description: List of user IDs (separated by comma), use the keyword 'all' to select all users

endpoints.name: /security/users/:user_id/roles
endpoints.description: Delete a specified relation user-roles

query.name: role_ids
query.description: List of role IDs (separated by comma), use the keyword 'all' to select all roles
